title: Gamification-Based Mobile Game Design and Operation Strategy for Mathematics Education: Focused on Computation, Graphing, and Problem-Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts (equations, functions, graphs) and educational technology environments, foundational principles of instructional design, and basic knowledge of game mechanics
context.additional_context: Real-time feedback via project-based assessments in smartphone-based learning environments (includes visualizing learning performance data and analyzing problem-solving patterns)

learning_goals: Design strategies to enhance mathematics learning effectiveness (including calculation skill reinforcement and graph interpretation strategies) by analyzing gamification elements in educational video games.
Develop a mobile game scenario incorporating cognitive load management strategies tailored to learner experience levels, including equation-solving and function visualization activities.

Learners can produce three or more mathematics education game prototypes reflecting interactions between concepts (e.g., function-graph connections, probability-statistics modeling) within six months, implement a continuous challenge system (including difficulty adjustment) and intuitive navigation (menu structure within three steps), and achieve an average suitability score of 4 or higher on a 5-point scale from an expert evaluation panel.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
